DOC.brief_summary: Objectives 1 . To assess head-perineum distance angle progression measure transperineal ultrasound obstetrician call predict delivery mode primiparous woman prolong first stage labour . 2 . To compare ultrasound assessment clinical examination .
DOC.brief_title: Prediction Delivery With Transperineal Ultrasound Women With Prolonged Labour . Multicentre Study
DOC.detailed_description: Variables Digitally assess cervical dilatation , fetal station position Ultrasound measure fetal head-perineum distance . Ultrasound measure angle progression Ultrasound assess position Possible confounders Ethnicity , maternal age , gestational age , BMI , induction labour , augmentation , epidural analgesia , birth weight , head circumference A two-dimensional ultrasound measurement obtain ultrasound device available delivery department . Fetal head descent measure short distance outer bony limit fetal skull perineum curve transabdominal transducer place transperineally labia transverse view ( 1 ) . The fetal descent also assess measure `` angle progression '' suggest Barbera et al . The ultrasound transducer place perineum mid-sagittal position labium pubic symphysis . The angle line symphysis line posterior part symphysis tangentially fetal skull contour measure ( 2 ) A transabdominal scan also perform determine fetal position describe previously . Positions ≥ 02.30 ≤ 03.30 hour record leave occiput transverse position ≥ 08.30 ≤ 09.30 right occiput transverse . Positions > 03.30 < 08.30 record occiput posterior position > 09.30 < 02.30 occiput anterior . ( 3 ) .
DOC.criteria: Primiparous woman single pregnancy gestation age > 37 week prolong first stage labor High risk pregnancy , premature delivery , multiple pregnancy
